title: Massive bombing in Ukraine following Russian allegations Kyiv blasted 2 air bases
description: Russia launched a volley of missiles at Ukraine’s energy grid on Monday, December 5, knocking out power in several regions, officials said.

title: Colombia: Dozens killed in landslide
description: The mudslide, unleashed by torrential rain, buried a bus and two other vehicles.

title: Pensions: French PM Borne insists on necessity of high-risk reform
description: The government could extend both the retirement age and the length of careers, the prime minister hinted in an interview.

title: South Africa's ruling party stands by leader, despite scandal
description: President Cyril Ramaphosa is accused in a parliamentary report of breaking anti-corruption laws.

title: Paris 2024: The undocumented workers building the Olympics
description: 'Le Monde' met several undocumented workers on Olympic sites in the northern suburbs of Paris. The government says it wants to regularize workers in sectors where there are labor shortages.

title: French YouTube star Norman questioned by police over rape charges
description: Norman Thavaud, who is one of France's top 3 most succesful YouTubers, was detained for questionning after accusations from six women.

title: Macron warns of rising xenophobia in visit to WWII camp
description: French President Emmanuel Macron spoke at the Camp des Milles, where Jews were rounded up during the war.

title: Louvre-Lens celebrates its 10th anniversary, with hopes of increasing tourism to northern France
description: Now well established in the mining community, the museum has yet to prove that it can contribute to the poor region's economic development.

title: Italy: Unlawful construction and tourism blamed for deadly mudslide on Ischia
description: An entire section of the island's mountain slid into the sea on November 26 after heavy rains, leaving 11 dead and one missing.

title: In the UK, a cautious Labour Party contends with the idea of gaining power
description: Rishi Sunak's arrival as British PM has not changed much for the Conservative party, which is still scoring low in opinion polls. The situation should benefit Labour within two years, although British politics has become highly uncertain.

title: Nick Bollettieri, coach of tennis superstars like Agassi, dies aged 91
description: His students said 'tennis wouldn't be where it is today' without the superstar coach's influence on the sport.

title: World Cup 2022: France has Mbappé-Giroud duo to thank for win over Poland
description: In the last 16 of the World Cup, Les Bleus dominated Robert Lewandowski's teammates (3-1). It was an opportunity for Olivier Giroud to break a record and for Kylian Mbappé to make an impression.

title: Infidelity, a lavish lifestyle and secrecy: Former Spanish king Juan Carlos exposed by his ex-lovers
description: The podcast 'Corinna and the King' gives a voice to his ex-mistress and the documentary series 'Saving the King' examines the protection he benefited from to keep scandals quiet.

title: In Iran, confusion over the fate of the morality police
description: Statements on Sunday by the attorney general about the supposed abolition of this unit raise questions. Arrests related to the wearing of the veil continue and further calls for demonstrations have been issued.

title: Iranian activists dismiss claims morality police disbanded, prepare for three-day strike
description: Iran's Prosecutor General announced on Sunday the shutting down of the regime's morality police whose conduct helped trigger months of protests.

title: As EU price cap on Russian oil kicks in, questions remain over whether it will work
description: The price cap at $60 per barrel came into force on Monday after the EU 27 agreed with the G7 and Australia on limiting Moscow's oil revenues worldwide.

title: The Iranian regime's repression is still failing
description: Saturday's ambiguous announcement regarding the abolition of the morality police, which was responsible for the death of Mahsa Amini, seems to betray the regime's disarray in the face of the people's anger.

title: Renewable energy bill set to be debated in divided Assemblée Nationale
description: The French bill went through the Sénat in November, but faces opposition in the Assemblée from the right and far right.

title: EU bans import of seaborne Russian crude oil
description: In the latest of the EU's sanctions against Moscow, Russian crude oil will no longer be allowed to enter European soil by sea as of Monday.

title: From the army to the Supreme Court, Israel's Netanyahu prepares for a right-wing overhaul
description: The likely future prime minister has yet to form his government, but he is already causing a stir among Israel's police, military and the Supreme Court.

title: 'The Uyghurs' ordeal suddenly became a nightmare for all Chinese citizens'
description: The current protests in China are the result of a fatal fire in Urumqi, the capital of the Uyghur region. This tragedy affected a population that was already severely repressed and was the catalyst for protests that swept through Chinese cities.

title: World Cup 2022: Olivier Giroud and France's late-blossoming love affair
description: The French striker has long been unfavorably compared to his counterpart Karim Benzema. But Olivier Giroud is happy to describe himself as an 'old-school striker'.

title: Power cuts this winter: Don't panic, says Emmanuel Macron
description: The government asked local authorities to anticipate possible cuts, but in an interview, the president said these are only 'fictitious scenarios'. If the energy savings plan is adhered to, there will be no cuts, he says.

title: War in Ukraine: Life in early winter Kyiv, plunged into darkness and cold
description: Those who have not left the Ukrainian capital are carrying on with life, finding their own methods to cope with the power cuts that Russia is using as a weapon of war.

title: Eric Ciotti, the 'eternal number two', plausibly the next leader of Les Republicans
description: With 42.73% of the activist votes, the MP for Alpes-Maritimes is well placed to win on Sunday, December 11 against Bruno Retailleau (34.45%) and become the next president of Les Républicains (LR).

title: The aesthetics of a Thanksgiving turkey ceremony
description: On November 21, the American president looked stylish for the Thanksgiving turkey pardoning ceremony. This did not leave Chocolate the turkey indifferent.

title: Plastic pollution: France's addiction to its 15 billion polystyrene yogurt pots
description: Recycling difficulties and intense lobbying by the plastics industry have kept this highly toxic material widely used in France.

title: Iran's repression told by protestors: 'When I got out of jail, I weighed only 46kg'
description: Samin and Araz share the abuse and intimidation they experienced in prison after being arrested for participating in the unprecedented protests shaking the country.

title: Considerable obstacles in prosecuting Russian war crimes
description: After the EU on Wednesday proposed a 'specialised court' backed by the UN to prosecute Russia's crime of aggression, experts question the feasability of such action.
